job description:
Description

Work Location: Enon Corporate Office

Job Overview:

IT Services is seeking an experienced Data Analyst developer.

Significant knowledge of retail data (suppliers, products, promotions, coupons, specials, discounts, inventory, credit, etc.) will allow the candidate to come up to speed more quickly.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

The vast majority of requests require working with members from:
  • Speedway business units (requestors)
  • Project managers
  • Business analysts
  • Development team members
  • Infrastructure team members
  • QA test and deployment team members
The Data Analyst will be responsible for:
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Minimum Requirements

Eligibility Requirements:

A minimum of:
  • Two (2) years' data mining experience
  • Two (2) years in a data analyst role
  • Two (2) years' experience designing, building and deploying solutions in a Data Warehouse using various import methods&transformations
Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

If Degreed, preferred Major: MIS, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or Statistics

Work Experience Desired:
  • Experience working with a Teradata Data Warehouse
  • Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • Technicalexpertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects), databases (SQL), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS)
  • Ability to use R and Python programming languages
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (MicroStrategy 10, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills
Other Skills:
  • Outstanding verbal communications skills with the ability to communicate equally effectively with business and technical team members
  • Excellent team skills
  • Excellent written communications skills
  • Must be self motivated working with a sense of urgency
  • Experience working with a project manager to formulate and use project plans and associated documents
  • Experience with retail data (suppliers, products, promotions, coupons, specials, discounts, inventory, etc.) preferred but not required
  • Knowledge/understanding around big data integration and data analytics
  • Foundation on statistical data modeling and visualization is a plus
  • Strong attention to detail
